abstract.t: This document defines abstract data objects for the Registry Provisioning Protocol (RPP). The definitions for domain name, contact, and host objects focus on the logical structure and constraints of their constituent data elements, independent of any specific data representation or media type. This document follows the architecture defined in [I-D.kowalik-rpp-architecture].

section.name: Introduction
section.t: The Registry Provisioning Protocol (RPP) requires a clear definition of its data objects. This document catalogues the fundamental resource objects managed through RPP: domains, contacts, and hosts.

In accordance with the RPP architecture , the definitions herein are abstract. They specify the logical data elements, their meanings, and their constraints, rather than a specific representation format. This approach ensures that the core data model can be consistently implemented across different media types.

section.name: Conventions and Terminology
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.name: Data Element Abstraction
section.t: Each resource is composed of logical data elements. A data element is a logical unit of information identified by a stable name, independent of its representation in any given media type. The definition for each element specifies its logical name, purpose, cardinality, data type, and constraints.

section.name: Extensibility
section.t: The set of data elements for a given resource object is extensible. New data elements MAY be defined and registered with IANA to support new features.

section.name: Data Element Semantics
section.t: The definition of each data element within an object consists of the following attributes:

ul.li: Name: A human-readable name for the data element.
Identifier: A machine-readable, unique identifier for the element, using camelCase notation.

li.t: Cardinality: Specifies the number of times an element may appear. The notation is as follows:

ul.li: Data Type: Defines the element's data structure, which can be a primitive type (e.g., String, Integer) or a reference to another component object.
Description: Explains the purpose of the data element and any other relevant information.
Constraints: Provides specific validation rules or limitations on top of the data type itself, such as value ranges.

li.t: Mutability: Defines the lifecycle of the data element's value. It MUST be one of the following:

ul.li: create-only: The element's value is provided during the object's creation and cannot be modified thereafter.
read-only: The element's value is managed by the server. It cannot be set or modified directly by the client, though it may change as a result of server-side operations.
read-write: The element's value can be set and modified by the client.

section.name: Common Data Types
section.t: This section defines primitive data types and structures that are re- used across multiple resource object definitions.

section.name: Identifiers
section.t: (Definition of a common type for identifiers, e.g., for contacts or hosts)

section.name: Timestamps
section.t: (Definition of a standardized timestamp format, e.g., ISO 8601)

section.name: Status Types
section.t: (Definition of a common structure for status flags on objects)

section.name: Component Objects
section.t: This section defines common component objects that are re-used in the definitions of top-level resource objects.

ul.li: Description: Represents a duration of time.
Description: The numeric value of the period.
Constraints: The value MUST be from 1 to 99, inclusive.
Description: The unit of the period.
Constraints: The value MUST be one of: "y" (years) or "m" (months).
Description: The name of the host.
Constraints: The value MUST be a syntactically valid host name.
Description: IP addresses associated with the host.
Constraints: Each value MUST be a syntactically valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.

aside.t: TODO: find a better name for Identifier
TODO: decide if association with attributes shouldn't be something else

ul.li: Description: Links a Contact resource to another resource, defining the role of the association.
Description: The identifier of the associated contact object.
Constraints: The value MUST be a valid, server-known Client Identifier.
Description: The role of the associated contact.
Constraints: For domain name associations, the value MUST be one of: "admin", "billing", or "tech".
Description: Contains information used to authorize operations on a resource object.

Data Elements: The structure of this object is intentionally left abstract to accommodate various authentication mechanisms (e.g., password, token). The server defines the specific elements and constraints.
Description: A Domain Name resource object represents a domain name and contains the data required for its provisioning and management in the registry.

section.name: Data Elements
section.t: The following data elements are defined for the Domain Name resource object.

ul.li: Description: The fully qualified name of the domain object.
Constraints: The value MUST be a fully qualified domain name that conforms to the syntax described in .
Description: A server-assigned unique identifier for the object.
Description: The current status descriptors associated with the domain.
Constraints: The value MUST be one of the status tokens defined in the IANA registry for domain statuses.
Description: The contact object associated with the domain as the registrant.
Constraints: The identifier MUST correspond to a valid Contact resource object known to the server.
Data Type: A collection of Contact Association Objects.
Description: A collection of other contact objects associated with the domain object.
Data Type: A collection of Nameserver Objects.
Description: A collection of nameservers associated with the domain.
Description: A collection of fully qualified names of subordinate host objects that exist under this domain.
Description: The identifier of the client that is the current sponsor of the domain object.
Description: The identifier of the client that created the domain object.
Description: The date and time of domain object creation.
Constraints: The value is set by the server and cannot be specified by the client.
Description: The identifier of the client that last updated the domain object.
Constraints: This element MUST NOT be present if the domain has never been modified.
Description: The date and time of the most recent domain object modification.
Constraints: This element MUST NOT be present if the domain object has never been modified.
Description: The date and time identifying the end of the domain object's registration period.
Constraints: The value is set by the server and cannot be specified by the client.
Description: The date and time of the most recent successful domain object transfer.
Constraints: This element MUST NOT be provided if the domain object has never been transferred.
Description: Authorization information to be associated with the domain object.

section.name: Create Operation
section.t: The Create operation allows a client to provision a new Domain Name resource. The operation accepts as input all create-only and read-write data elements defined for the Domain Name Resource Object.
In addition, the following transient data element is defined for this operation:

ul.li: Description: The initial registration period for the domain name. This value is used by the server to calculate the initial expiryDate of the object. This element is not persisted as part of the object's state.

section.name: Read Operation
section.t: The Read operation allows a client to retrieve the data elements of a Domain Name resource. The server's response MAY vary depending on client authorization and server policy.
The following transient data elements are defined for this operation:

ul.li: Description: Controls which host information is returned with the object.
Constraints: The value MUST be one of "all", "del" (delegated), "sub" (subordinate), or "none". The default value is "all".
Description: Authorization information provided by the client to gain access to the full set of the object's data elements.

section.name: Delete Operation
section.t: The Delete operation allows a client to remove an existing Domain Name resource. The operation targets a specific resource object identified by its name.
The server SHOULD reject a delete request if subordinate host objects are associated with the domain name.

section.name: Renew Operation
section.t: The Renew operation allows a client to extend the validity period of an existing Domain Name resource. The operation targets a specific resource object identified by its name.
The following transient data elements are defined for this operation:

ul.li: Description: The current expiry date of the domain name. The server MUST validate this against the object's current expiryDate to prevent unintended duplicate renewals.
Description: The duration to be added to the object's registration period. This value is used by the server to calculate the new expiryDate.

section.t: Contact Resource Object

section.name: Object Description
section.t: A Contact resource object represents the social information for an individual or organization associated with other objects.

section.name: Data Elements
section.t: (This section will list and define the abstract data elements for a contact.)
Host Resource Object

section.name: Object Description
section.t: A Host resource object represents a name server that provides DNS services for a a domain name.

section.name: Data Elements
section.t: (This section will list and define the abstract data elements for a host.)

section.name: RPP Object Registry
section.t: This document establishes the "Registry Provisioning Protocol (RPP) Object Registry". This registry serves as a definitive, hierarchical catalogue of all resource objects, component objects, data elements, and operations used within RPP.

section.name: Registration Policy
section.t: The policy for adding new objects, data elements, or operations to this registry is "Specification Required" .

section.name: Registry Structure
section.t: The registry is organized as a collection of Object definitions. Each Object definition MUST include:

li.t: A header containing the Object Identifier, Object Name, Object Type (Resource or Component), a brief description, and a reference to its defining specification.
A "Data Elements" table listing all persisted data elements associated with the object. Each entry MUST specify the element's Identifier, Name, Cardinality, Mutability, Data Type, and description.
If applicable, an "Operations" section. For each operation, the registry MUST provide:

ul.li: The Operation's Name and a description.

A "Parameters" table listing all data elements that are provided as input to the operation but are not persisted as part of the object's state. Each entry MUST specify the parameter's Identifier, Name, Cardinality, Data Type, and a description.

section.name: Initial Registrations
section.t: The initial contents of the RPP Object Registry are defined below.
Object: period
Object Name: Period Object
Object Type: Component
Description: Represents a duration of time.
Reference: [This-ID]
Data Elements

tr.td: The numeric value of the period.

section.t: Object: nameserver
Object Name: Nameserver Object
Object Type: Component
Description: Represents a single nameserver.
Reference: [This-ID]
Data Elements

tr.td: IP addresses associated with the host.

section.t: Object: contactAssociation
Object Name: Contact Association Object
Object Type: Component
Description: Links a Contact resource to another resource, defining its role.
Reference: [This-ID]
Data Elements

tr.td: The identifier of the associated contact object.
The role of the associated contact.

section.t: Object: authInfo
Object Name: Authorization Information Object
Object Type: Component
Description: Contains authorization credentials for an operation.
Reference: [This-ID]
Data Elements
Object: domainName
Object Name: Domain Name Resource Object
Object Type: Resource
Description: Represents a domain name and its associated data.
Reference: [This-ID]
Data Elements

tr.td: The fully qualified name of the domain object.
A server-assigned unique identifier for the object.
The current status descriptors for the domain.
The client ID that created the object.
The client ID that last updated the object.
The timestamp of the last update.
The timestamp of the last successful transfer.

section.t: Operations
Operation: Create
Description: Provisions a new Domain Name resource.
Parameters

tr.td: The initial registration period for the domain name.

section.t: Operation: Read
Description: Retrieves the data elements of a Domain Name resource.
Parameters

tr.td: Controls which host information is returned.
Credentials to authorize access to full object data.

section.t: Operation: Delete
Description: Removes an existing Domain Name resource.
Parameters: (None)
Operation: Renew
Description: Extends the validity period of a Domain Name resource.
Parameters

tr.td: The expected current expiry date, for validation.
The duration to add to the registration period.

section.t: Security Considerations
(This section will discuss security issues related to the data objects, such as data privacy, validation, and potential for misuse.)
